timeline.message: Update option documentation. Move LockRenewalStatus and make it package-private.

timeline.author: JonathanGiles
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -639,17 +640,23 @@ public ServiceBusSenderClient buildClient() { /** * Builder for creating {@link ServiceBusProcessorClient} to consume messages from a session-based Service Bus - * entity. {@link ServiceBusProcessorClient ServiceBusProcessorClients} provides a push-based mechanism that - * invokes the message processing callback when a message is received or the error handler when an error occurs - * when receiving messages. To create an instance, therefore, configuring the two callbacks - - * {@link #processMessage(Consumer)} and {@link #processError(Consumer)} are necessary. By default, a - * {@link ServiceBusProcessorClient} is configured with auto-completion and auto-lock renewal capabilities. - * {@link ServiceBusProcessorClient ServiceBusProcessorClients} created by this builder can be configured to - * consume messages from {@link #maxConcurrentSessions(int) multiple sessions concurrently}. By default, the + * entity. {@link ServiceBusProcessorClient} processes messages and errors via {@link #processMessage(Consumer)} + * and {@link #processError(Consumer)}. + * + *

+ * By default, the processor: + *

    + *
  • Automatically settles messages. Disabled via {@link #disableAutoComplete()}
    • + *
  • Processes 1 session concurrently. Configured via {@link #maxConcurrentSessions(int)}
    • + *
  • Invokes 1 instance of {@link #processMessage(Consumer) processMessage consumer}. Configured via + * {@link #maxConcurrentCalls(int)}
    • + *
+ * {@link #maxConcurrentCalls(int)} (int) sessions concurrently}. By default, the * processor will receive messages from a single session with rollover. + *

replies.bodyText: I thought I caught that one. thanks!
replies.author: conniey

timeline.bodyText: Should we explain about lock renewal also here ?
timeline.author: hemanttanwar

replies.bodyText: We don't have that ability in the session processor? I don't think we have auto renew session lock.
replies.author: conniey
